title: Yunus calls for law against online fraud
body: Chief adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus stressed on enacting a separate law on an urgent basis to prevent fraudulence using artificial intelligence or online. ‘Honourable chief adviser at the on Thursday’s meeting of council of advisers gave a clear instruction to formulate a separate law on a very urgent basis to prevent fraudulence using artificial intelligence or online in Bangladesh,’ chief adviser’s press secretary Shafiqul Alam said while briefing the media about the meeting at the Foreign Service Academy. He said that Yunus stressed on formulating the law specifying punishments and other necessary measures to combat the fraudulence, observing that the menace is tarnishing the country’s image globally and causing harassment of the citizens to receive different services like visa processing and others. A large number of people have also been the victims of financial fraudulence, the press secretary noted.
